alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Goshen County; Laramie Valley; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 23 at 1:15PM MST until February 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills. Widespread wind chills 25 to 40 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Southeast Wyoming and the Western Nebraska Panhandle. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous wind chills may cause frostbite in as little as 5 minutes. Hypothermia can also set in quickly if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, knit hat, and mittens.
